episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the peculiar morning routine of King Louis XIV, a Picasso artwork eaten by a dog, the US Navy's instructions for escaping giant clams, and the historical use of the number 100 to mean 120.

facts.fact: Over 100 people used to watch King Louis XIV get up and get dressed every day.
There is an original Picasso that no one will ever see because it was eaten by the dog.
During World War II, the US Navy diving manual contained detailed instructions for what to do if eaten by a giant clam.
